multiple_choice_question.text: What does the orange shading in the figure represent?
choices: The set of all fixed points under the duality group S4
The fundamental domain F in the complex τ plane
The area where the singlet conformal dimension is minimized
The area where the model has enhanced flavor symmetry

multiple_choice_question.text: What method was used to generate the values for the singlet scaling dimension (Δ1) shown in the figure?
What do the different colors in the figure represent?
choices: Different values of the central charge CT
Different values of the complex coupling constant τ
Different scaling dimensions of the doublet operators (Δ2, Δ2\', Δ2\'\', Δ2\'\'\')
Different values of the Zamolodchikov metric
The scaling dimension of the cubic chiral primary operator O
The Zamolodchikov metric on the conformal manifold
The two-point function of the quadratic chiral primary operators QI
The squared OPE coefficient of the chiral bilinear operator
